title: 111_hr4532
content: The Act titled "Social Security Disability Applicants' Access to Professional Representation Act of 2010" extends attorney fee withholding procedures to Title XVI permanently. It also extends fee withholding procedures to qualified non-attorney representatives. The Commissioner shall extend fee withholding procedures to non-attorney representatives who meet specific prerequisites, including holding a bachelor's degree or equivalent qualifications and passing an examination. The Commissioner requires non-attorney representatives to meet specific prerequisites, including passing an examination on relevant provisions of the Act and recent developments, securing professional liability insurance, undergoing a criminal background check, and completing continuing education courses on ethics and professional conduct. The Commissioner may assess representatives reasonable fees for administering prerequisites. Fees collected will be credited to trust funds or the general fund based on allocations determined by the Commissioner. Fees collected will be available for obligation to a certain extent. The Commissioner may assess representatives reasonable fees for administering prerequisites, which are available for obligation only to the extent provided in advance in appropriations Acts. Amounts appropriated remain available until expended for administering the prerequisites. Amendments are made to certain sections of the Social Security Protection Act of 2004. The Social Security Act of 2004 is amended to remove certain provisions and set a deadline for full implementation by March 1, 2010. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
